intro: Rubus versutus, commonly known as the common blackberry shrub, is a perennial plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a dark purple or black color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Rubus versutus is often found in woodland edges, thickets, and disturbed areas across North America.
